text: The Wagyu Beef Steak was absolute perfection - like butter melting in my mouth. The sommelier's wine pairing elevated the experience to new heights. Worth every penny of the $95.
An exquisite Lobster Thermidor with perfect texture and flavor balance. The portion was just right for such a rich dish. Service was impeccable throughout.
The Truffle Risotto was flavorful but I expected more truffle presence for $65. The ambiance and service were outstanding though.
The Foie Gras was sublime - perfectly seared with a delightful fruit compote. My only complaint was the tiny portion size for $55.
The Duck Confit was disappointingly dry, especially at $75. Expected more from a restaurant of this caliber.
Caviar Blini was worth every cent of $120 - the perfect balance of salty caviar and delicate blini. A once-in-a-lifetime experience.
The Saffron Seafood Paella was beautifully presented and delicious, though the seafood could have been slightly more generous for $80.
Veal Chop was good but not exceptional - at $90 I expected more flavor complexity. The chocolate souffl√© dessert saved the meal.
Perfect anniversary dinner! Every course from the amuse-bouche to the dessert was a masterpiece. The $150 wine pairing was worth it.
$95 for a steak that was overcooked and $55 for a tiny slice of foie gras? This place is style over substance. Never again.
